citeinfo.title: National Transportation Atlas Databases (NTAD) 2008

pubinfo.publish: Research and Innovative Technology Administration's Bureau of Transportation Statistics (RITA/BTS)

descript.abstract: United State Rail Lines is a line theme representing railroad tracks in the United States at a 1:100,000 scale. The data set covers all 50 States plus the District of Columbia.
descript.purpose: The data set provides location and partial attribute information for use in national and regional network analysis applications.
descript.supplinf: At the time of publishing the CD significant updates to the layer were underway. Please check <http://gis.fra.dot.gov> for the latest version of the dataset

idinfo.datacred: The Federal Railroad Administration (FRA) develops and maintains the rail network geospatial data layer. The Research and Innovative Technology Administration's Bureau of Transportation Statistics (RITA/BTS) compiled and formatted the data for release on the National Transportation Atlas Databases (NTAD) 2008.
idinfo.native: Microsoft Windows XP Version 5.1 (Build 2600) Service Pack 2; ESRI ArcCatalog 9.2.5.1450

citeinfo.origin: Research and Innovative Technology Administration's Bureau of Transportation Statistics (RITA/BTS)

attracc.attraccr:
The previous 2 million network attributes were conflated to the 100k network. The FRA reports the following fields as incomplete: Signal System, Number of Tracks, and Subdivision.
The FRA reports that as many nodes as possible have been identified with a name. Many nodes in the 1:100,000 scale rail network are 'mapped' to a node in the 1:2,000,000 scale rail network.
Special note concerning trackage rights: In some cases, a 'short line' railroad may operate on its larger railroad connection(s) as its billing railroad. For example, the larger railroad(s) treat traffic originating or terminating on the short line as if it were originating or terminating on its own line; perform the billing, car reporting, and car tracking; then share the revenue with the short line. These trackage rights may exist as four, five, or six in the sequence, while one and two remain empty. BTS quality checks were to cross reference the place dataset with the state dataset, to determine that the spatial data and attribute data were accurate

dataqual.logic: The network is topologically connected and the data set is geographically accurate at the 1:100,000 scale.

horizpa.horizpar: The horizontal accuracy for these data can be stated as being that associated with data compiled at the 1:100,000 scale.

procstep.procdesc: Verify and validate the rail network.

attr.attrdef: The reporting mark of the 1st owning railroad. A mark of 'XXXX' indicates an abandoned link. Rule 260 codes are used where available. A mark of 'DUMX' indicates an added connecting link.

The reporting mark of the 3rd owning railroad, if any.
Reporting mark of the 1st railroad having trackage-rights.

The VERSION is a 2-digit number that will be incremented for all records in the database whenever a new release is distributed.

cntorgp.cntorg: Research and Innovative Technology Administration's Bureau of Transportation Statistics (RITA/BTS)

stdorder.ordering: Call (202-366-DATA), or E-mail (answers@bts.gov) RITA/BTS to request the National Transportation Atlas Databases (NTAD) 2008 DVD. The NTAD DVD can be ordered from the online bookstore at www.bts.gov. Individual datasets from the NTAD can also be downloaded from the Geographic Information Program web sit at http://www.bts.gov/programs/geographic_information_services/.

distinfo.custom: Call (202-366-DATA), or E-mail (answers@bts.gov) RITA/BTS to request the National Transportation Atlas Databases (NTAD) 2008 DVD. The NTAD cdrom can be ordered from the online bookstore at www.bts.gov. Individual datasets from the NTAD can also be downloaded from the Geographic Information Program web sit at http://www.bts.gov/programs/geographic_information_services/.
